name: Brandon Black
cooked: Sure, you can get the same result with TXHASH + CSFS, but now you have hash modes (tagging with the selected mode, annex hashing) that are only used with CSFS where those could be omitted if the same general hash structure was available separately in the separate contexts. (If you haven’t already, reading Template Key might make this more clear)
topic_title: CATT: thoughts about an alternative covenant softfork proposal
topic_html_title: CATT: thoughts about an alternative covenant softfork proposal
raw: Sure, you can get the same result with TXHASH + CSFS, but now you have hash modes (tagging with the selected mode, annex hashing) that are _only_ used with CSFS where those could be omitted if the same general hash structure was available separately in the separate contexts. (If you haven't already, reading [Template Key](https://github.com/reardencode/bips/blob/ccda3646d82fe589103c472d5c2e4e0627c85cd7/bip-template-key.mediawiki) might make this more clear)
